text: hello the world number one men's tennis
player novak djokovic has been included
in the draw for the australian open
despite it being unclear whether he'll
be deported the serbian is at the center
of a dispute about whether he was
medically exempt from receiving a covid
vaccine all eyes are on the australian
immigration minister alex hawke who's
yet to make a decision on the case
here's shimer khalil in melbourne with
the latest we really didn't learn
anything about
about the his visa status and whether or
not he's going to be allowed to remain
here and
play and defend his title we know he's
in the draw he's the top seed he'll be
playing uh fellow serb um yamir
kikwanovic but we don't know if this is
going to go ahead actually when the
australian open starts he was um he was
training earlier today he was training
yesterday i think the optics of him
training is his message to say that i
want to do this i want to i want to
compete i want to defend my title but
whether or not the government sees it
the same way you know is another
question entirely and to be honest it
feels like they're just dragging this on
now they're dragging their feet
everybody
is waiting for an answer on whether or
not he's going to play but of course you
know there's a lot of politics in the
background that cannot be
denied this is a government that has
been under an immense amount of pressure
about the way that they have handled
covert 19 especially the omicron wave
and they want to be seen as taking every
step in considering novak djokovic his
case remember he also made those
revelations yesterday about providing
false information on his travel
declaration visa he called human error
an administrative mistake that he blamed
his agent for but he also admitted that
he violated covert 19 isolation rules
because he knew he was infected he knew
he was positive and did an interview
with the french publication lee keep
anyway and at one point took off his
mask for a photo shoot we know that the
immigration minister is considering all
of this plus additional information that
was provided by novak djokovic's team
and has yet to make a decision
and shima we did almost think perhaps
that announcement was imminent when we
heard that the draw for the australian
open was delayed
by a little while but that draws now
being made do we know what's going on in
the immigration department why the delay
and why is this decision taking so long
no one knows and you're right there was
this bizarre moment earlier today where
everybody was waiting for the draw
waiting to see what happens there and
then the draw was delayed and then we
understood it was delayed after uh it
was announced that that scott morrison
was going to speak and we had this
moment where we just thought ah we are
going to have a decision now and that's
what they're waiting for and we didn't
get one and so the draw went ahead
anyway and and i think everybody is a
bit puzzled now about why this delay you
know the government wants to
essentially say that they have strong
grounds that they've looked at this you
know very very carefully they've looked
at all the details and they've made that
decision but the longer this takes the
closer you get uh to the australian open
which is due to start on monday
the more confusing the situation gets
and the more tense it actually becomes
chimer khalil with that situation of
limbo there in melbourne but what about
the view from novak djokovic's home
country of serbia i spoke to our
correspondent guy delany who's in
belgrade
we wake up every morning and we have a
look we anxiously scan the australian
media the bbc our bbc colleagues what
are they saying we scan the serbian
media what's going on in there and it
wasn't quite the roller coaster ride
that we had on monday when novak
djokovic was released from quarantine
and then there were fears that he might
be rearrested and deported but no he's
out again it was a bit of a i don't know
a children's rollercoaster today a small
dip when that uh that that draw for the
australian open was postponed and scott
morrison was going to speak and again
like cheyenne says we all thought is
this the moment and it wasn't looking
good for novak djokovic at that point
but now he's in the first round of the
australian open at least he's been drawn
in the first round the australian open
and hey good news there will be a
serbian player in the second round of
the australian open this year whatever
happens whether that's novak djokovic or
not of course we don't know
indeed and that revelation by novak
djokovic in that statement that he did
break self-isolation rules in serbia
when he knew he was covered positive is
there likely to be any comeback any
consequence of that
well we spoke to the prime minister
earlier this week and we asked her if it
was shown that novak djokovic had
knowingly gone out and about
while he was kova's positive
what would that mean and she said it
would be a clear breach of serbian
regulations we spoke to a legal expert
yesterday and asked what a breach of
that regulations would mean for novak
djokovic he said well it's a breach of
the serbian legal code which carries a
maximum prison sentence of up to three
years imprisonment he's unlikely to get
that but he may get a fine or he may get
community service we may get something
exemplary simply because he is novak
djokovic but the difficulty is of course
he's not living in serbia he lives in
monte carlo so any enforcement of that
would be a quite tricky it would seem
that's guy dalloni in belgrade the
serbian capital while we wait to hear
and we still haven't heard a clear
decision from the australian immigration
minister about what is going on with
novak djokovic and whether or not he
will be deported we will be bringing
that news to you as soon as we get any
decision
